intro: Sphondylium asperum, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and wastelands. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and the flower heads consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
